book
Class ProductService

java.lang.Object
  book.ProductService

public final class ProductService
extends java.lang.Object

This class is the Facade to the entities that make up the Products (Stocks), and the Product Books (“booked” tradables on the Buy and Sell side). All interaction with the product books and the buy and sell sides of a stock’s book will go through this Facade

Author:
Urvi

                                  throws NoSuchProductException,
                                         InvalidArgumentException
For each Price in the ProductBookSide, calculates the total volume at that price. This is done via a call to ProductBook.getBookDepth()

setMarketState

public void setMarketState(MarketMessage.MarketState ms)
                    throws InvalidArgumentException,
                           InvalidVolumeValueException,
                           OrderNotFoundException,
                           InvalidMarketStateTransition
Updates the market state to the new state passed in (CLOSED, PREOPEN, OPEN) and then creates a MarketMessage to be published. If the new state is OPEN then the market is opened for every product book, if the new state is CLOSED then the market is closed for every product book

Parameters:
ms - new state of the market
Throws:
InvalidArgumentException - if ms is null
InvalidVolumeValueException
OrderNotFoundException
InvalidMarketStateTransition - if updating to the new state results in a transition that is not allowed. The only valid transitions are CLOSED --> PREOPEN --> OPEN --> CLOSED
See Also:
ProductBook.closeMarket(), ProductBook.openMarket()

createProduct

public void createProduct(java.lang.String product)
                   throws InvalidArgumentException,
                          ProductAlreadyExistsException
Creates a new stock product that can be used for trading

Parameters:
product - Product to be created
Throws:
InvalidArgumentException - if product is null or empty
ProductAlreadyExistsException - if product has already been created

                        DataValidationException,

submitOrder

public java.lang.String submitOrder(Order o)
                             throws InvalidMarketStateException,
                                    NoSuchProductException,
                                    InvalidArgumentException,
                                    InvalidVolumeValueException
Adds the provided Order to the appropriate ProductSideBook. This is done via a call to ProductBook.addToBook(Order).

Parameters:
o - The Order to be submitted
Returns:
The identifier of the Order that was added
Throws:
InvalidMarketStateException - if an attempt to submit an Order is made when the market is CLOSED
NoSuchProductException
InvalidArgumentException
InvalidVolumeValueException
See Also:
ProductBook.addToBook(Order)

submitOrderCancel

public void submitOrderCancel(java.lang.String product,
                              ProductBookSide.BookSide side,
                              java.lang.String orderId)
                       throws InvalidMarketStateException,
                              NoSuchProductException,
                              InvalidArgumentException,
                              InvalidVolumeValueException,
                              OrderNotFoundException
Cancels an Order for given side of the book. This is done via ProductBook.cancelOrder(BookSide, String)

Parameters:
product - Product symbol of Order to be cancelled
side - Side of the book (BUY or SELL)
orderId - Identifier of the Order to be cancelled
Throws:
InvalidMarketStateException - if an attempt to cancel an Order is made when the market is CLOSED
NoSuchProductException - if product is not a product in the book
InvalidArgumentException
InvalidVolumeValueException
OrderNotFoundException
See Also:
ProductBook.cancelOrder(ProductBookSide.BookSide, String)

submitQuoteCancel

public void submitQuoteCancel(java.lang.String username,
                              java.lang.String product)
                       throws InvalidMarketStateException,
                              NoSuchProductException,
                              InvalidArgumentException,
                              InvalidVolumeValueException
This method cancels a Quote for a username. This is done via a call to ProductBook.cancelQuote(String)

Parameters:
username -
product -
Throws:
InvalidMarketStateException - if an attempt to cancel a Quote is made when the market is CLOSED
NoSuchProductException - if product is not a product in the book

InvalidVolumeValueException
See Also:
